main_definition: International Standard Book Number is a unique numeric identifier assigned to books, used globally to identify titles in publishing.

meanings_and_examples.example: The ISBN of the latest Harry Potter book is 978-0545589360.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Book identifier for cataloguing and ordering purposes in libraries, stores, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: Librarians use ISBNs to organize books on shelves and create digital databases.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Numeric code used by online retailers and e-book platforms
meanings_and_examples.example: When purchasing an eBook, the platform displays its ISBN for verification purposes.
